intro: Tylophora cuspidata, commonly known as the spikeflower vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, giving it its common name. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, hairy seeds. Tylophora cuspidata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
